title: How has the proportion of staff who feel under pressure to attend work while ill changed over time?
analysis_commentary:
For comparison, the proportion of staff feeling pressure to attend work despite feeling unwell, as reported by the annual Survey of NHS Staff, are also included.

A substantial proportion of NHS staff have felt under pressure to attend work when ill. In 2009 just over one fifth of staff reported that they felt pressure to attend work despite having felt unwell. This was followed by year on year increases in 2010, 2011 and 2012 where it reached a peak of 27% of staff reporting pressure to attend work despite feeling unwell. This has subsequently decreased in 2013 and 2014, where currently 23% of staff have felt pressure. Although of the staff who attended work while unwell, the majority (91%) reported that they had put themselves under pressure to attend (data not shown).
